description: Government of the Czech Republic announces a state of emergency. By default, this lasts 30 days (without consent of the Parliament needed).

On March 12, 2020, Czech Government announces a state of emergency. By default, this lasts 30 days (without consent of the Parliament needed). On April 9, 2020, the state of emergency has been extended to April 30, 2020.
Czech Republic bans all international airlines from operating direct flights from China to Czech Republic.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Czech Republic's Security Council discourages from traveling to the Italian regions of Veneto and Lombardy.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Czech Republic's Ministry of Health temporarily banned direct flight connection from South Korea as well as from all airports in the Italian regions of Emilia-Romagna, Piemont, Lombardy and Veneto.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Czech Republic's Ministry of Health temporarily banned direct flight connection from South Korea as well as from all airports in the Italian regions of Emilia-Romagna, Piemont, Lombardy and Veneto.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Czech government implements "akce Korona" - an operation where law enforcement carries out temperature checks on border crossings.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Czech Government bans Czech citizens and foreign citizens with permanent residence in Czech Republic from leaving the Czech Republic.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Czech Government bans all foreign nationals from entering the country, with the exception of individuals with long-term residence in Czech Republic and individuals whose entry is in the interest of the state.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On March 18 the Czech Government issued a policy addressing cross-border workers, ordering them to limit their movement within Czech Republic. This policy also cancelled some of the exceptions from free movement restriction (policy from March 15). Cross-border workers will be subjected to temperature checks while crossing the border and a COVID-19 test will be administered to them if they show symptoms of the illness.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 7, Czech Government announces the travelers' obligation to declare the date and means of their repatriation to the embassy of the country from which they are departing. Special online form was set up on the website of Ministry of Foreign Affairs for these purposes.
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On April 27th, new emergency directive issued by the Czech Government takes effect. It restates some previously instated policies and loosens some travel restrictions, allowing Czech citizens to cross the border in certain special circumstances (such as work obligations or visiting family). These citizens must present themselves with a negative COVID-19 test no older than 4 days upon inbound travel or enter 14-day quarantine.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 14, 2020, Czech Ministry of Health informs about the purchase of medical devices and medical equipment intended for health service providers. The ministry ordered 359 lung ventilators and 520 thermographic cameras. A total of 44 lung ventilators have already been delivered.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Czech Ministry of Health bans the export and sale of type FFP3 respirator masks to organisations or individuals outside the medical or law enforcement sectors.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Czech Ministry of Health bans all persons - aside from manufacturers - from exporting hand sanitizer products.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Czech Government plans to re-orient two hospitals exclusively on care for COVID-19 patients. Specifically, this should be Nemocnice na Homolce in Prague and Fakultn√≠ nemocnice u sv. Anny in Brno, each with the capacity of around 300 hospital beds.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Local authorities mandate travelers in public transport to cover their nose and mouth for the entirety of their transportation. No specification is given on what type of mask or cover is required, it is explicitly stated that home-made masks or scarves are sufficient.
city: Prague; extended to all major cities with notable public transportation infrastructure in Czech Republic.

description: On April 1st, Czech Government orders all regional administrations to secure special COVID-19 hospital wards with the capacity of at least 60 hospital beds per 100 000 residents of the region, to be used flexibly according to the development of the pandemic. The hospital wards are to be clearly marked as reserved for COVID-19 patients.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
target_province: All regions - 13 + capital city of Prague.

description: On April 9, 2020, Czech government changes the criteria for identifying a critical infrastructure elements. Pharmaceutical product manufacturers with significant production capacities in the Czech Republic have been granted critical infrastructure status.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Czech Government prevents all residents from appearing in public (outside of their homes) without a physical cover of their mouth and nose. Respirators, face masks, home-made masks as well as scarves are admissible. Update on April 9, 2020: the driver and the family members living in the same household traveling in the car, public transport drivers in closed cabins and persons with severe autism spectrum disorders do not have to wear face masks.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As of Monday May 25th, visits to patients who are currently hospitalized were allowed again by the Czech government.
On March 15, 2020, Czech government calls soldiers and customs officers to help the Czech police to perform tasks related with the measures against the spread of the COVID-19
type_text: On March 15, 2020, Czech government calls soldiers and customs officers to help the Czech police to perform tasks related with the measures against the spread of the COVID-19

description: Czech Government dedicates special hours in grocery stores specifically for individuals of 65+ years of age; anyone younger who is not a legal guardian of an elderly customer nor employee of the store cannot enter the store facilities between 10am and 11am.
type_text: Dedicated time when grocery stores can only be used by elderly citizens to limit their contact  with potential virus carriers.

description: Czech Government reserves the time between 7am and 9am for grocery stores to only be visited by citizens over 65 years of age (and their guardians, if needed).
type_text: Time reserved for seniors in grocery stores.

description: Czech Government changes the time reserved for seniors over 65 years of age to visit grocery stores to 8am - 10am. This applies specifically to stores over 500 meters square in size of facility.
type_text: Time reserved for the elderly in grocery stores.

description: Czech Government mandates shops which sell baked goods which are not prepackaged to maintain special hygiene measures. Shops are to ensure that people are able to maintain 2m distance, preventing overcrowding.
type_text: Increased hygienic measures in shops selling food, specifically baked goods.

description: On April 6, Czech Government decides to allow individual outdoor sports (such as cycling, tennis or running). These will be able to be carried out without a face mask if people maintain 2 meters distance from each other.
type_text: Certain outdoor sports were allowed again, given that social distancing measures can be maintained during the activity.

description: On April 9, 2020, at the request of the Minister of Culture, Czech government approved financial assistance to cultural institutions and artists who lost their livelihoods due to government quarantine measures. The Ministry of Culture will receive from the government budget reserve 770 million Czech crowns to support non-state artistic entities and up to 300 million Czech crowns for remediation of impacts on contributory organizations of the Ministry of Culture, depending on whether the restrictions adopted by the government will continue after May 31, 2020. The Ministry will support, for example, access to art through digital technologies, etc.
type_text: On April 9, 2020, at the request of the Minister of Culture, Czech government approved financial assistance to cultural institutions and artists who lost their livelihoods due to government quarantine measures. The Ministry of Culture will receive from the government budget reserve 770 million Czech crowns to support non-state artistic entities and up to 300 million Czech crowns for remediation of impacts on contributory organizations of the Ministry of Culture, depending on whether the restrictions adopted by the government will continue after May 31, 2020. The Ministry will support, for example, access to art through digital technologies, etc.
enforcer: National Government,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On April 9, 2020, Czech government increases the maximum number of armed forces that can be called to perform the tasks of the Czech police by another two thousand. (Increase from 2096 to 4096 called armed forces).
type_text: On April 9, 2020, Czech government increases the maximum number of armed forces that can be called to perform the tasks of the Czech police by another two thousand. (Increase from 2096 to 4096 called armed forces).

description: On April 9, 2020, Czech government increases the maximum number of armed forces that can be called to perform the tasks of the Czech police by another two thousand. (Increase from 2096 to 4096 called armed forces). Update on April 14, 2020: The Czech government decided to allocate the armed forces in facilities providing social services. Up to 360 soldiers may be assigned for this purpose.
type_text: On April 9, 2020, Czech government increases the maximum number of armed forces that can be called to perform the tasks of the Czech police by another two thousand. (Increase from 2096 to 4096 called armed forces). Update on April 14, 2020: The Czech government decided to allocate the armed forces in facilities providing social services. Up to 360 soldiers may be assigned for this purpose.

description: Czech Republic Ministry of Health implements a protective measure targeted specifically at the Prague International Airport and its employees. It includes a verbal announcement about what to do should travelers develop COVID-19 symptoms in every plane landing in Prague, gathered in an information leaflet.
Czech Republic Ministry of Education extends protective measures to apply to 4 more international airports, namely airports in Ostrava, Karlovy Vary, Brno and Pardubice. Same measures apply.
Prague Hygienic station issued quarantine and hygienic guidelines to be followed by universities and schools which educate or accommodate Chinese students.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Czech Republic Ministry of Health implements an exception to the mandatory quarantine measures from March 6, 2020, relevant to freight transportation employees, medical ambulance crews and commercial pilots. If observing symptoms of COVID-19, such individuals are to report to their general practitioner. They are mandated to use increased hygiene measures during their work (including respirators type FFP2 or FFP3).
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Czech Government imposes mandatory home quarantine on individuals traveling from (or recently residing in) risk countries, which were specified as: China, South Korea, Iran, Italy, Spain, Austria, Germany, Switzerland, Sweden, Netherlands, Belgium, Great Britain, Norway, Denmark and France.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 16, 2020, Czech Regional Hygiene Station in Olomouc introduces quarantine for minimum of 14 days for more than 20 municipalities in the area due to significant spread of COVID-19 disease
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Czech Government encourages citizens over 70 years of age to isolate at home, only leaving to obtain necessary medical care. Mayors and local governments are asked to assist senior citizens with securing groceries and other necessities.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 30, Czech Government announced that all travelers entering the country will have to undergo strict at-home quarantine for the duration of at least 14 days, no matter the country they visited.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On April 14, 2020, Czech government presented a medium-term plan to abandon the extraordinary restrictions such as quarantine or lockdowns. The presented government strategy, which is about to start on April 20, 2020, includes actions in the time period until June 8, 2020. However, all these steps are indicative only and are subject to possible change.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: Czech Government manned law enforcement workers from pursuing an additional income outside of their employment in law enforcement. This policy is to last as long as the national state of emergency is in place.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is closed/locked down

description: On April 1, Czech Government introduces new exceptions to restrictions of non-essential business. Starting April 2 at 6am, home-ware stores will be allowed to open - given that they sell cloth face masks or supplies from which cloth face masks can be created.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down

description: On April 6, Czech Government issues an exception to restriction of non-essential businesses relevant for compost plants and raw material collection / recycling centers.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is closed/locked down

description: As of April 9, the Government asks all open businesses (to whom exceptions from general restriction of non-essential businesses apply) to provide rubber or plastic gloves and hand sanitizer to all customers entering the store's facilities. Customers are also expected to maintain 2 meters distance while shopping. Government issued information brochures detailing this policy are to be displayed inside the store.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is closed/locked down

description: As of April 27, shops up to 2 500 meters square are allowed to open (given that they are not situated within shopping centers of over 5 000 meters square in area). Hygienic guidelines formulated by the Ministry of Health are in place as to prevent crowding and limit social contact. Shops of bigger area are allowed to restrict their shopping space to 2 500 meters square with tape or other restriction and resume activity under the same guidelines.
As of April 27, driving schools are allowed to resume activity under specific hygienic rules. These include wearing of PPE, frequent sanitation of contact surfaces and limiting interpersonal contact.

As of April 27th, fitness centers and gyms are allowed to open under specified hygiene guidelines formulate by the Ministry of Health. Some of there include the mandatory use of PPE and prohibition of using communal showers and changing spaces. All contact surfaces are to be desinfected regularly.
As of April 27, libraries are allowed to re-open. The must provide hand sanitizer to all customers, librarians must wear gloves and returned books are to be left untouched for at least 2 days.

As of April 27th, the outdoor spaces of zoos, botanical and dendrological gardens are allowed to reopen. All restaurant facilities within these gardens are to remain closed (or sell only pre-packaged refreshments), contact surfaces are to be sterilized often and measures are to be taken to prevent overcrowding.

As of May 11, shops over 2500 meters square and shopping centers over 5000 meters square in area are allowed to re-open under certain hygienic guidelines formulated by the Ministry of Health. Restaurants and other explicitly banned businesses are excluded.
As of May 11, restaurants which sell food through a take-away window or seat their customers in open-air gardens will be allowed to reopen.
As of May 11, cosmetic services (such as beauty salons, hair styling salons, manicure and pedicure salons, beauty clinics) will be allowed to reopen under specific hygienic guidelines.
As of May 11, museums and galleries will be allowed to reopen under specific social distancing guidelines.
As of Monday May 25th, indoor as well as open-air pools are allowed to reopen by the Czech government.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description: As of Monday 25th, businesses which require the breaking of skin (such as tattoo parlors, piercing salons, permanent makeup stores) are allowed to re-open by the Czech Government.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description: On Monday May 25th. the indoor areas of restaurants, cafes (including those situated in shopping centers over 5000 meters square), hotels, campsites, castles and historical sights, zoos, botanical gardens, dendrological gardens, saunas and wellness centers are allowed to open. Therefore, these businesses are allowed to resume operation. Special hygiene measures still apply (such as wearing a mask when required, sanitizing hands and keeping a social distance).
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions

description: Czech Government ruled that all events over 5000 participants need to report to their local hygienic station.
Czech Government bans cultural, educational and sports events with over 100 participants. Court proceedings, governmental meetings and board meetings are exempted.
As of April 24th, Czech government allows public gatherings of up to 10 people. This applies to public spaces as well as outdoor sporting grounds.

As of April 24, Czech Government allows religious services to take place with maximum 15 people in attendance and under specified hygienic guidelines. Same rules are to be applied to all religious events (such as weddings or christening ceremonies).
As of May 11, events up to 100 participants are allowed to take place. This includes sporting events, religious events and weddings, cultural and educational events.
As of Monday May 25th, events of up to 300 participants are allowed again by the Czech government.

Czech Ministry of Health decides that the planned BMW IBU World Cup Biathlon as planned between March 5 and March 8 2020 (annual sports event with thousands of attendees) will go on without an audience.

Czech Ministry of Health cancels public visiting hours in hospitals, social services provider centers and retirement homes. Exception applies in the case of underage patients, patients who require legal guardianship, pregnant women and patients in final stages of a terminal illness.

Czech Government restricts free movement to all unnecessary travel. People are permitted to leave their houses to travel to work, to purchase groceries or medication, visit family or exercise / get fresh air.

Czech Government restricts free movement to all unnecessary travel. People are permitted to leave their houses to travel to work, to purchase groceries or medication, visit family or exercise / get fresh air.

On March 24 (effective at 6am), Czech Government restricts free movement of residents in groups bigger than two individuals. Exception applies to families, work or business activities and funerals.

Citizens are advised to keep a distance of 2 meters from each other at all times.

On April 9, 2020, Czech Ministry of Health regulates the regime in prisons. In order to limit the risk of spreading COVID-19, the Prison Service should accommodate the prisoners according to their respective workplace classification.

On April 9, 2020, Czech Ministry of Health extends the mandated limited operation of authorities and institutions until 19 April. Starting April 20, all public authorities and administrative institutions are to comply with stricter hygiene rules. (a distance of minimum 2 meters, hand disinfection available, increased disinfection of spaces)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government
